rows.title: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene

text_introduction.eng: Safe Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) helps us and keeps our communities safe from harmful germs.

rows.title: Handwashing with soap

text_introduction.eng: Washing your hands with soap is one of the most important things you can do to keep strong and healthy.

rows.text_introduction: Washing your hands with soap is one of the most important things you can do to keep strong and healthy.

rows.title: When to wash your hands

text_introduction.eng: To avoid the spread of germs it is important to wash your hands with soap several times a day.

rows.title: How to wash your hands

text_introduction.eng: Washing your hands is easy! Just follow these simple steps.

rows.title: Keeping healthy

text_introduction.eng: Prevent diseases by drinking safe water, using clean toilets and washing your hands often.

rows.text_introduction: Prevent diseases by drinking safe water, using clean toilets and washing your hands often.

rows.title: Clean toilets

text_introduction.eng: A clean toilet means good hygiene.  A dirty one can mean disease.

rows.title: Healthy home

text_introduction.eng: A safe place to live is possible when your home and its surroundings are clean.

rows.title: Safe drinking water

text_introduction.eng: Clean water saves money and improves health. Collect water from a safe source, maintain clean containers, and treat water to make it clean.
